      • read

        public static int[][] read(java.lang.String fileName)
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method reads a 2D data set from the specified file. The Graphics' industry standard is width by height (width x height), while programmers use rows x cols / (height x width).
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file
        Returns:
        a 2D array (rows x cols) of the data from the file read
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • findMinValue

        public static int findMinValue(int[][] grid)
        Parameters:
        grid - a 2D array from which you want to find the smallest value
        Returns:
        the smallest value in the given 2D array

      • findMaxValue

        public static int findMaxValue(int[][] grid)
        Parameters:
        grid - a 2D array from which you want to find the largest value
        Returns:
        the largest value in the given 2D array

      • drawMap

        public static void drawMap(java.awt.Graphics g,
                           int[][] data)
        Given a 2D array of elevation data create a image of size rows x cols, drawing a 1x1 rectangle for each value in the array whose color is set to a a scaled gray value (0-255). Note: to scale the values in the array to 0-255 you must find the min and max values in the original data first.
        Parameters:
        g - a Graphics context to use
        grid - a 2D array of the data

      • indexOfMinInCol

        public static int indexOfMinInCol(int[][] grid,
                                  int col)
        Scan a single column of a 2D array and return the index of the row that contains the smallest value
        Parameters:
        grid - a 2D array
        Returns:
        the index of smallest value from grid at the given col

      • drawLowestElevPath

        public static int drawLowestElevPath(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                     int[][] data,
                                     int row,
                                     int col)
        Find the minimum elevation-change route from West-to-East in the given grid, from the given starting row, and draw it using the given graphics context
        Parameters:
        g - - the graphics context to use
        grid - - the 2D array of elevation values
        row - - the starting row for traversing to find the min path
        Returns:
        total elevation of the route

      • indexOfLowestElevPath

        public static int indexOfLowestElevPath(java.awt.Graphics g,
                                        int[][] data)
        Generate all west-to-east paths, find the one with the lowest total elevation change, and return the index of the row that path starts on.
        Parameters:
        g - - the graphics context to use
        grid - - the 2D array of elevation values
        Returns:
        the index of the row where the lowest elevation-change path starts.
